body_content.explanation: used to refer to a leaf or flower that has no stem of its own but is attached directly to the main stem of the plant, or to refer to a plant or tree that has such leaves or flowers:
examples: The spike bears clusters of sessile flowers.
The sessile oak is so called because its acorns are carried directly on the outer twigs.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to organisms that are permanently attached to one place and cannot move around:
examples: Sea otters feed mainly on sessile or very slow-moving invertebrates.
